results.title: Fat girl = For my sister = A ma soeur! [DVD] (E)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Breillat, Jean-Francois Lepetit, Urania Pictures, Immagine e Cinema (IT), Flach Film, CB Films (France) and Arte France
results.brief_description: Catherine Breillat (Romance, 36 fillette) courts controversy with this starkly compelling coming of age film. Anais (Anais Reboux) is a depressed and overweight thirteen-year-old girl who lives in the shadow of her beautiful and sexually alluring fifteen-year-old sister, Elena. On holiday with their aloof mother and apathetic father, the sisters meet Fernando, a handsome Italian law student who forms an instantaneous attraction to Elena. Elena is aware of her appeal, although naive about the manipulations of men, and yearns to lose her virginity with someone she loves. Fernando, an experienced sexual predator, sets about conquering Elena through coercion, flattery, guilt inducing overtures and the weight of his experience. Whilst Elena vacillates between acquiescence and resistance, Anais is a mute and unwilling witness. As well as displaying in a confronting manner the deflowering of Elena, Breillat also explores the complex relationship between the sisters that oscillates between abuse and affection, displaying several scenes in which they compare their morality and opposing perspectives about love and sex. Breillat successfully interrogates her subject matter of the abject adolescent condition in a powerful manner allowing much room for viewer contemplation. But a shock ending that taps into Anais’ wish-fulfilment in a most brutal fashion, divided audience and critical reaction. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Fat freedom
results.creator_credit: Richard Capaner, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Using soft washes of colour, this animated film portrays a man’s desire to escape his heavy human body, changing it into forms that let him fly, dance and rejoice and allow him to express his inner needs and fantasies. Music by Ben Low.

results.title: Family reactions
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to provide the intellectual disability residential care worker with an insight into what it means to be part of a family that includes a child with developmental disabilities, an understanding of the grieving process and how families cope, an appreciation of the needs of different families, to learn ways of interacting positively with parents, to examine methods of developing effective partnerships with parents and most importantly develop an appreciation of the uniqueness of families and their reactions. Accompanied by 44p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Faster pussycat kill, kill. Mondo topless
results.creator_credit: Russ Meyer, Eve Meyer and Eve Productions
results.brief_description: Russ Meyer made famous this b-grade exploitation style of popular culture and in his films explored the people living on the edge or outside of the mainstream culture of the day. “Faster Pussycat Kill! Kill!” a cult classic centres around three women who are on a wild rampage of violence and revenge, a new breed of violence where sex is it’s favourite mantle and terrorizing people the order of the day. These “homicidal go-go’s” start their journey with a drag race across the desert followed by a violent showdown with local ranchers. The film is filled with hard-line one-liners, for example in answering the question “What’s the point?” the ringleader vixen Varla (Tura Satana) replies “The point is of no return, and you’ve just crossed it”. The second film “Mondo Topless” equally a cult classic is a montage of kinky topless go-go dancers accompanied with voice overs from the dancers talking about thier trade, motivations and views of their sexuality, (more titillating than informative - no pun intended).

results.title: Family plot [DVD]
results.brief_description: Two parallel plots run through Alfred Hitchcock’s final film. In one strand, a phoney medium and her cabbie boyfriend are hired by an unsuspecting elderly woman to help locate her long lost nephew heir. In the other tale, an equally sinister couple, a jeweller and his girlfriend, have kidnapped a rich Greek shipping magnate and are hoping to be paid a ransom in diamonds. The two stories intersect in a brilliant move of comic direction which finds them both at the cemetery. Cast includes Karen Black, Bruce Dern, Barbara Harris and William Devane. Screenplay by Ernest Lehman, based on the novel “The Rainbird pattern” by Victor Canning. Cinematography by Leonard J. South. Music by John Williams.

results.title: Fast times at Ridgemont High [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Amy Heckerling, Irving Azoff, Art Linson and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: ‘Fast times at Ridgement High’ is the seminal “teen” movie, one that finds a balance between the obligatory sex and drugs, as well as dealing with issues such as juvenile delinquency, strict teachers, underage sex and teen pregnancy. At the centre of the film are siblings Stacy (Jennifer Jason Leigh) and Brad (Judge Reinhold), Stacy is quickly learning about men and sex while Brad lusts after her best friend and gloats about his career prospects. Supporting characters include theatre usher Rat (Brian Backer) who has a crush on Stacy, and Rat’s friend Mike Damone (Robert Romanus) - a smooth talking sleaze. With dialogue that does not progress much beyond expressions such as “no way”, Sean Penn steals the limelight as the definitive surfer dude Jeff Spicoli - spinning a legion of imitators in subsequent films. Based on the book by Cameron Crowe.

results.title: Fast talking
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Ross Matthews, AFI [au] and Old Data
results.brief_description: An Australian feature film that presents the story of fifteen year old Steve Carson, a con artist, spirited rebel and determined survivor in the face of crumbling family relationships. The many influences in his life are highlighted in a comedy of fast dialogue and outrageous escapades. Starring Rod Zuanic, Toni Allaylis, Chris Truswell, Gail Sweeny and Steve Bisley.

results.title: Absolutely fabulous. Series 3
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Jon Plowman, BBC and Saunders and French
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Absolutely fabulous”.
Three episodes from series 3 of the popular British comedy series, “Absolutely fabulous”, a hilarious satire, set in the London fashion world, that plays with elements of the absurd and high camp. “Door handle”: In need of an overhaul, Eddie sets about getting fit, renovating the kitchen and uses an electronic organiser to get her life in order. Meanwhile, Patsy is concerned for her health and turns to Saffie for advice. In a desperate search for the perfect door handle, the pair fly to New York. “Happy new year”: Eddie decides that her New Year’s Eve resolution is to have more fun. Hence, she and Patsy plan a night on the tiles. Much to Eddie’s chagrin, Patsy’s glamorous and estranged sister joins them. “Sex”: Eddie and Patsy reminisce about their wild sexual exploits in the 1960s and 70s; Eddie determines to get in touch with her sexual side by hiring a male prostitute. Saffie and her study group prepare their genetics and ethics lecture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Spiers, Jon Plowman, BBC and Saunders and French

results.title: Absolutely fabulous
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Jon Plowman and BBC
results.brief_description: Absolutely fabulous is one of the most successful British comedy shows; an hilarious situation comedy that plays with elements of the absurd and high camp. Edwina (Jennifer Saunders) is a baby-boomer mother, fashion victim extraordinaire. Her best friend is the cocaine-snorting nymphomaniac Patsy (Joanna Lumley). Part of the show’s success comes from its reversal of roles. It is the practical long-suffering Saffie, Edwina’s daughter, who sweeps up after her mother, and the in-your-face portrayal of drug-taking, sex-loving, materialistic women who are spoilt, selfish, vacuous but undeniably good fun. Always colourful, often brilliant, “Absolutely fabulous” confirmed Saunders and co-writer Dawn French as two of the best comedians of their generation.

results.title: Family circles
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Tom Daly, Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shows how the interplay of home and school influences the development of children. The experiences of three children illustrate vividly how parental indifference, lack of imagination, and emotional conflict at home can destroy the confidence and enthusiasm necessary for a child’s success at school. (Awards: Cleveland; Toronto; Montevideo)
